column4: this sounds like a bit much I know, but are there any guides for installing ubuntu? I've went through the install process 3 times with no success :(

well, I was custom partitioning with XFS....some of the settings available seemed unknown to me so I just more or less guessed on them...it installs the base packages and LILO, asking me where to install that (have no clue)..on one occasion, the winXP bootloader was still on there, and on another attempt, it did boot but dropped me to a command line..
so, the 'bootable' flag on the ubuntu partition should be set to on, correct?
